content: Items in Trash are automatically deleted after 30 days.

comment.text: The TrashErasureWarning translation key is used to display a notification that files in the trash will be automatically deleted after 30 days. This message appears on desktop devices as part of a warning section, reminding users of this retention policy. The translator should ensure the wording accurately conveys this automated deletion process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word '÷Ö÷Ä' (or) is used incorrectly. It should be '÷Ö÷Ä’æ’°' (orva) to properly indicate 'days'.

The word 'eliminados' (eliminated) might be too strong. 'Apagados' (deleted) or 'removidos' (removed) would be more appropriate in this context, as it refers to a system's automatic action, not a destructive one.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Os Itens no Lixo ser√£o automaticamente apagados/removidos ap√≥s 30 dias.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation includes a Sinhala number (ëá¨) within the English number '30'. This is unconventional and may confuse users. It's better to keep the English number.
The word '·±¢·±ö‡∂ö‡∂±‡∑î' (makanan≈´) is a less common way to express 'deleted' and might be confusing. A more commonly used term would be more accessible.

The translation '–°—Ç–∞–≤–∫–µ —É –û—Ç–ø–∞–¥—É —Å—É –∞—É—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∏—Å–∞–Ω–µ –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω 30 –¥–∞–Ω–∞' is not accurate. '–°—Ç–∞–≤–∫–µ' means 'items' but in this context, 'items' is better translated as 'elements' or 'predmeti'.  '–û–±—Ä–∏—Å–∞–Ω–µ' is passive voice, which doesn't quite convey the automatic nature of the action. The correct translation should imply that the items *will be* automatically deleted.
The use of '–ö–æ—à –∑–∞ –æ—Ç–ø–∞–¥' is preferable to '–û—Ç–ø–∞–¥' to clarify the term 'Trash'.
The translation "Stavke u Otpadu su automatski obrisane nakon 30 dana" implies the items *have already* been deleted. The English says they *will be* deleted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Stavke u Otpadu ƒáe biti automatski obrisane nakon 30 dana.
